data.title: Upcoming Shows — The Flushing Remonstrance
data.text:
Aelita: Queen of Mars

Join us for the legendary science-fiction film Aelita: Queen of Mars with a live score from The Flushing Remonstrance.

Said to be the first full-length science fiction movie ever made, Aelita is a fantastic adventure about Los, an engineer living in Moscow, who dreams of Aelita, the Queen of Mars, and builds a spaceship to take him to her. They fall in love, but Los soon finds himself embroiled in a proletarian uprising to establish socialism on the red planet.

Influenced by the Russian avant-garde constructivist movement, the bold artistry of Aelita’s Martian costumes and sets contributed enormously to the science fiction look as we know it. The Flushing Remonstrance celebrate the centennial of this major work of early futuristic cinema by bringing it to life with their all-new live score.

ONE NIGHT ONLY! Tuesday, August 6, 2024, 9:30 pm at Nitehawk Cinema. Advance tickets are on sale now: Advance Tickets

View Event →

Classic Queer Cinema

Join us as The Flushing Remonstrance perform their original live accompaniment to two of the seminal films of queer cinema.

James Sibley Watson and Melville Webber's "Lot In Sodom" (1933) is a sensual depiction of the biblical story of Sodom and Gomorrah, filled with sinewy and semi-clad bodies, delirious bacchanals devoted to physical pleasure, and a searing, cataclysmic finale depicting the fall of a city devoted to adoration of the flesh.

Alla Nazimova and Charles Bryant's adaptation of Oscar Wilde's "Salomé" (1923) also visits the Bible to depict the story of Salomé (Nazimova), who performs the Dance of the Seven Veils for her lustful stepfather King Herod, demanding John the Baptist’s head on a platter as a reward. Featuring stunning costumes and Aubrey Beardsley–inspired art design, and with a (rumored) exclusively gay and bisexual cast, it's considered to be one of America’s first art films.

ONE NIGHT ONLY! Wednesday, July 31, 2024, 8:00 pm at The Francis Kite Club. Advance tickets are on sale now: Advance Tickets

View Event →

Classic Queer Cinema

Join us to celebrate Pride Month as The Flushing Remonstrance perform their original live accompaniment to two of the seminal films of queer cinema.

James Sibley Watson and Melville Webber's "Lot In Sodom" (1933) is a sensual depiction of the biblical story of Sodom and Gomorrah, filled with sinewy and semi-clad bodies, delirious bacchanals devoted to physical pleasure, and a searing, cataclysmic finale depicting the fall of a city devoted to adoration of the flesh.

Alla Nazimova and Charles Bryant's adaptation of Oscar Wilde's "Salomé" (1923) also visits the Bible to depict the story of Salomé (Nazimova), who performs the Dance of the Seven Veils for her lustful stepfather King Herod, demanding John the Baptist’s head on a platter as a reward. Featuring stunning costumes and Aubrey Beardsley–inspired art design, and with a (rumored) exclusively gay and bisexual cast, it's considered to be one of America’s first art films.

ONE NIGHT ONLY! Wednesday, June 12, 2024, 7:30 pm at Cobble Hill Cinemas. Advance tickets are on sale now: Advance Tickets

View Event →

Cowards Bend The Knee and Guy Maddin Rarities - SOLD OUT

SHOW IS SOLD OUT!

Join us for a special program of films personally selected by Guy Maddin for all-new scores composed and performed by The Flushing Remonstrance.

Guy Maddin’s Cowards Bend The Knee is a “deliriously over-the-top blend of operatic melodrama, recycled Greek tragedy, motifs pilfered from film noir, and silent-film conventions” (Film Journal International), presented here along with his short films Trumpet Island Host Séance (world premiere screening), Workbooks: Chimney/Rooster/Zookeeper (world premiere screening), and Odin’s Shield Maiden, all with live accompaniment.

ONE NIGHT ONLY! Wednesday, May 22, 2024, 8:00 pm at Film Forum, Greenwich Village, Manhattan

Advance tickets are on sale now: Advance Tickets

View Event →

Lucifer Rising: A Celebration of Kenneth Anger

Experience an exploration of sound, light, darkness, and magick at Purgatory, as The Flushing Remonstrance perform their acclaimed original live accompaniment to four films by Kenneth Anger (Lucifer Rising; Inauguration of the Pleasure Dome; Invocation of My Demon Brother; Eaux d'Artifice), with occult performances and burlesque by Szandora LaVey, Glitter Macabre, and PNK VLVT WTCH.

Thursday, May 16, 2024 at Purgatory, 675 Central Avenue, Bushwick, Brooklyn. Doors 8 pm, show 9 pm.

$12 in advance, $15 at the door. 21+.

Advance tickets

View Event →

The Films of Maya Deren

Join us as The Flushing Remonstrance perform their original live accompaniment to the films of Maya Deren.

Maya Deren has been called the "mother of the trance film," and was one of the most groundbreaking filmmakers of our time, influencing filmmakers such as Chantal Akerman, Orson Welles, Ingmar Bergman, Stanley Kubrick, David Lynch, and Yorgos Lanthimos. Her films are intensely personal, symbolic, and surreal, and are a truly otherwordly experience to see.

The Flushing Remonstrance will be performing their acclaimed live scores to Deren's "At Land" (1944), "Ensemble for Somnambulists" (1951), "Meshes of the Afternoon" (1943), "Ritual in Transfigured Time" (1946), "The Very Eye of Night" (1958), "Witch's Cradle" (1943), and Stan Brakhage's tribute to Maya Deren, "Water for Maya" (2000).

Monday, April 22, 2024, 8:00 pm at The LetLove Inn, 27-20 23rd Avenue, Astoria, Queens. FREE ADMISSION, with donations appreciated.

https://www.franciskiteclub.com/

View Event →

The Films of Maya Deren

Join us as The Flushing Remonstrance perform their original live accompaniment to the films of Maya Deren.

Maya Deren has been called the "mother of the trance film," and was one of the most groundbreaking filmmakers of our time, influencing filmmakers such as Chantal Akerman, Orson Welles, Ingmar Bergman, Stanley Kubrick, David Lynch, and Yorgos Lanthimos. Her films are intensely personal, symbolic, and surreal, and are a truly otherwordly experience to see.

The Flushing Remonstrance will be performing their acclaimed live scores to Deren's "At Land" (1944), "Ensemble for Somnambulists" (1951), "Meshes of the Afternoon" (1943), "Ritual in Transfigured Time" (1946), "The Very Eye of Night" (1958), "Witch's Cradle" (1943), and Stan Brakhage's tribute to Maya Deren, "Water for Maya" (2000).

Thursday, April 11, 2024, 8:00 pm at The Francis Kite Club, 40 Loisaida Avenue in the East Village. Advance tickets are on sale now ($10 advance, $15 at the door). Advance tickets on sale here

https://www.franciskiteclub.com/

View Event →

The Phantom of the Opera

Cobble Hill Cinemas presents The Flushing Remonstrance performing their original live score to the silent horror classic "The Phantom of the Opera."

Lon Chaney's performance in the title role is one of the greatest in silent film, and this timeless tale of mystery, drama, and horror will come to life with an all-new powerful and eerie musical score. Murder, mayhem, art, music, and love - what more could you want?

ONE NIGHT ONLY! Wednesday March 13, 2024, 7:30 pm. Advance tickets are on sale now.

Advance Tickets

View Event →

The Phantom of the Opera

Kew Gardens Cinemas presents The Flushing Remonstrance performing their original live score to the silent horror classic "The Phantom of the Opera."

Lon Chaney's performance in the title role is one of the greatest in silent film, and this timeless tale of mystery, drama, and horror will come to life with an all-new powerful and eerie musical score. Murder, mayhem, art, music, and love - what more could you want?

ONE NIGHT ONLY! Wednesday March 6, 2024, 7:30 pm. Advance tickets are on sale now.

Advance Tickets

View Event →

Angelic Lanterns: The Films of Guy Maddin

Join us for Angelic Lanterns, a special program of films personally selected by Guy Maddin for all-new scores composed and performed by The Flushing Remonstrance.

Guy Maddin’s Cowards Bend The Knee is a “deliriously over-the-top blend of operatic melodrama, recycled Greek tragedy, motifs pilfered from film noir, and silent-film conventions” (Film Journal International), presented here along with his short films Blue Mountains Mystery Séance (world premiere screening), Send Me To The ‘Lectric Chair (US premiere), Odin’s Shield Maiden (NYC premiere), and Once A Chicken, Always A Chicken (NYC premiere), all with live accompaniment.

ONE NIGHT ONLY! Thursday, February 22, 2024, 9:30 pm at Nitehawk Cinema, Williamsburg.

Advance tickets are on sale now: Advance Tickets

View Event →

Psychic Cinema: Experimental Films - Nick Didkovsky and Robert Kennedy

Join us at The LetLove Inn for an evening of fantastic experimental short films with live musical accompaniment.

Visual delights will include experimental classics from Bill Morrison, Joel Schlemowitz, Stan Brakhage, Peter Tscherkassky, Barbara Hammer, Lawrence Jordan, and more

The duo of Nick Didkovsky (Doctor Nerve) and Robert Kennedy (The Flushing Remonstrance) will perform their all-new live scores to these amazing films, bringing you a night of incredible sonic exploration and a feast for the eyes and ears.

ONE NIGHT ONLY! Monday, December 11, 2023 at 9:00 pm. FREE ADMISSION, with donations appreciated.

http://www.doctornerve.org/.

View Event →

A Page of Madness

Join us as The Flushing Remonstrance perform their original live accompaniment to A Page of Madness.

Teinosuke Kinugasa's fascinating 1926 masterwork follows a newly hired janitor in a mental hospital as he experiences a hallucinogenic odyssey and loses control of the border between visions and reality. A Page of Madness is one of the silent film era's eeriest and most distinctive horror films, and The Flushing Remonstrance will bring it to life with an all-new chilling live score.

One night only! At the Francis Kite Club, 40 Loisaida Avenue (Avenue C), East Village, Manhattan. Doors at 7:00 pm, show at 8:00. Suggested donation $10.

https://www.franciskiteclub.com/

View Event →

The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari

Join us at Cobble Hill Cinemas as The Flushing Remonstrance perform their original live accompaniment to Robert Wiene's mindbending Expressionist masterwork and Weimar classic The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari.

A tale of madness and terror featuring stunning sets and art design, and arguably the first true horror film, The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari remains terrifying over a century after it first stalked the screen. The Flushing Remonstrance bring this classic to life with an all-new dark and chilling live score.

ONE NIGHT ONLY! Wednesday, December 6, 2023 at 7:30 pm. Advance tickets are on sale now.

Advance Tickets

View Event →

Angel's Egg - Duo Lumière

Join us at Footlight Underground for a mesmerizing evening of anime with live accompaniment.

Angel's Egg (1985) is a groundbreaking collaboration between two anime legends that intertwines Mamoru Oshii’s (Ghost in the Shell) personal reflections on theology, existentialism and evolution with Yoshitaka Amano’s (Final Fantasy, Sandman, Vampire Hunter D) fantastical ink art style. A rarely screened and hard-to-find cult classic, Angel's Egg is an allegorical fantasy enriched by symbolism and biblical allusion, a beautifully melancholic film that ruminates on the tragic underpinnings of existence in a world untouched by God.

Duo Lumière, the duo of Robert Kennedy (The Flushing Remonstrance) on keyboards/electronics and Claire Jackson on guitar/electronics will perform their all-new live scores to Angel's Egg plus Yoshitaki Amano’s anime short film 1001 Nights (1998), bringing you a night of incredible sonic exploration and a feast for the eyes and ears.

ONE NIGHT ONLY. Sunday, December 3, 2023 at 7:30 pm. Advance tickets are on sale now ($10-$20 sliding scale): Advance Tickets

https://www.footlightunderground.com/

View Event →

Persistence of Vision - Experimental Films with Live Accompaniment by Duo Lumière

Join us at The LetLove Inn for a mesmerizing evening of experimental films with live accompaniment.

Duo Lumière, the duo of Robert Kennedy (The Flushing Remonstrance) on keyboards/electronics and Claire Jackson on guitar/electronics will perform their all-new live scores to a dazzling selection of experimental shorts, bringing you a night of incredible sonic exploration and a feast for the eyes and ears.

Films by Toshio Matsumoto, Piotr Kamler, Jacques Drouin, Stan Brakhage, Pierre Hebert, David Lynch, and many more.

ONE NIGHT ONLY! Monday, November 13, 2023 at 9:00 pm. FREE admission, with donations appreciated.

View Event →

Nosferatu

The Flushing Remonstrance return on Halloween night to perform their live score for F.W. Murnau's seminal 1922 vampire film and horror classic Nosferatu.

Come join in the music of the children of the night with one of the silent era's most influential films. Nosferatu's eerie, gothic feel, groundbreaking special effects and editing -- and a chilling performance from Max Schreck as the vampire -- set the template for all horror films to follow.

Advance tickets are on sale now ($10-$20 sliding scale): Advance Tickets

View Event →

Nosferatu

The Flushing Remonstrance return to The LetLove Inn to perform their live score for F.W. Murnau's seminal 1922 vampire film and horror classic Nosferatu.

Come join in the music of the children of the night with one of the silent era's most influential films. Nosferatu's eerie, gothic feel, groundbreaking special effects and editing -- and a chilling performance from Max Schreck as the vampire -- set the template for all horror films to follow.

FREE admission; donations welcome.

View Event →

Metropolis - SOLD OUT

SHOW IS SOLD OUT.

Join us in electric ladyland as The Flushing Remonstrance perform their all-new live score to Fritz Lang's Expressionist film masterpiece "Metropolis." A groundbreaking and influential work of science fiction, "Metropolis" tells the powerful story of human vs. machine and class struggle, set above and beneath a dazzling futuristic city.

One night only! Wednesday, September 20, 2023, 7:30 pm.

Ticket link: https://www.cobblehilltheatre.com/movie/3359/metropolis-1927

View Event →

A rarely screened and hard-to-find cult classic, Angel's Egg is an allegorical fantasy enriched by symbolism and biblical allusion, a beautifully melancholic film that ruminates on the tragic underpinnings of existence in a world untouched by God.

Duo Lumière, the duo of Robert Kennedy (The Flushing Remonstrance) on keyboards/electronics and Claire Jackson on guitar/electronics will perform their all-new live scores to Angel's Egg and a selection of anime shorts, bringing you a night of incredible sonic exploration and a feast for the eyes and ears.

ONE NIGHT ONLY! Monday, July 10, 2023 at 9:00 pm. FREE ADMISSION, with donations appreciated.

Join us as The Flushing Remonstrance perform their original live accompaniment to two of the seminal films of queer cinema.

James Sibley Watson and Melville Webber's "Lot In Sodom" (1933) is a sensual depiction of the biblical story of Sodom and Gomorrah, filled with sinewy and semi-clad bodies, delirious bacchanals devoted to physical pleasure, and a searing, cataclysmic finale depicting the fall of a city devoted to adoration of the flesh.

Alla Nazimova and Charles Bryant's adaptation of Oscar Wilde's "Salomé" (1923) also visits the Bible to depict the story of Salomé (Nazimova), who performs the Dance of the Seven Veils for her lustful stepfather King Herod, demanding John the Baptist’s head on a platter as a reward. Featuring stunning costumes and Aubrey Beardsley–inspired art design, and with a (rumored) exclusively gay and bisexual cast, it's considered to be one of America’s first art films.

Tickets $10-$20 (sliding scale); advance tickets on sale now at: Advance Tickets

View Event →

Psychic Cinema: Surrealist/Dada/Experimental Films with Live Accompaniment

Join us at The LetLove Inn for an evening of fantastic short films with live musical accompaniment.

Visual delights will include surrealist, Dada, and experimental classics from Fernand Léger, Hans Richter, Man Ray, Władysław Starewicz, Slavko Vorkapich, Mary Ellen Bute, Joseph Cornell, Marie Menken, Wallace Berman, Peter Tscherkassky, and Guy Maddin.

The duo of Nick Didkovsky (Doctor Nerve) and Robert Kennedy (The Flushing Remonstrance) will perform their all-new live scores to these amazing films, bringing you a night of incredible sonic exploration and a feast for the eyes and ears.

ONE NIGHT ONLY! Monday, May 22, 2023 at 9:00 pm. FREE ADMISSION, with donations appreciated.

View Event →

Music of Curiosities at Coney Island USA presents: The Unknown + Un Chien Andalou

Join us as Music of Curiosities presents The Flushing Remonstrance performing their chilling and kaleidoscopic live score to the 1927 silent horror classic The Unknown and legendary surrealist film Un Chien Andalou.

Starring Lon Chaney and Joan Crawford, and directed by Tod Browning (Dracula, Freaks), The Unknown is one of the great silent films, with a startling and intense performance by Chaney as Alonzo, on the run from the law and hiding out in the circus as The Armless Wonder - a performer who uses his feet to hurl knives. Against a background of circus life and the sinister shadow of the underworld, The Unknown is a psychosexual fever dream of love and revenge.

Un Chien Andalou is Luis Buñuel and Salvador Dali's groundbreaking depiction of fetish, religion, and obsessive sexuality that forever changed the aesthetics of film.

Hosted by Kita St. Cyr with a special opening live music set by Gender Clown (featuring Pnk Vlvt Wtch, Prince Viper, Razor De Rockefeller & Miss Honey Boy).

One night only! Saturday, May 13, 2023. Show starts at 8:00. Tickets are $20 and available for advance purchase.

Tickets: https://coney-island-usa.myshopify.com/products/moc051323

https://www.coneyisland.com/

View Event →

The Films of Kenneth Anger

Experience an exploration of sound, image, darkness, and magick at Freddy's Bar and Backroom, as The Flushing Remonstrance perform their acclaimed original live accompaniment to three films by Kenneth Anger (Lucifer Rising; Inauguration of the Pleasure Dome; Invocation of My Demon Brother).

Doors at 7:30, show starts at 8:00. Suggested donation $10 (at the door).

View Event →

Nosferatu

Join us for F.W. Murnau's seminal 1922 vampire film and horror classic "Nosferatu," with original live accompaniment by The Flushing Remonstrance.

Come join in the music of the children of the night with one of the silent era's most influential films. Nosferatu's eerie, gothic feel, groundbreaking special effects and editing -- and a chilling performance from Max Schreck as the vampire -- set the template for all horror films to follow.

Also performing will be Theophobia, with a full set of their inimitable theatrical synth pop/rock/performance art/comedy.

Doors 7:30 pm, show starts at 8:00.

Tickets $12 at the door; admission 21 & up with a valid ID.

View Event →
